data.title: Nolatet, Bonerama & More Are Bringing Mardi Gras Madness To NYC
data.meta_description: Mardi Gras season is in full swing at Brooklyn's The Hall at MP, with a huge roster of New Orleans-style music and food to get you in the festival spirit.
data.text:
UPDATE: The New Orleans boozy brunches will continue at least through the end of March! Additionally, Crawfish boils have been added throughout March & April (3/18, 3/19, 4/1, 4/2, 4/8, 4/9). Tickets at Nolafunk.com.

Mardi Gras season is in full swing at Brooklyn’s The Hall at MP, with a huge roster of New Orleans-style music and food to get you in the festival spirit. Kicking off properly with NOLA’s own Rebirth Brass Band on 12/29, the series will also offer a FREE Boozy Brunch with the High & Mighty Brass Band every Saturday and Sunday, as well as a Crawfish Boil every Friday and Saturday night with different talent each week. Mardi Gras weekend will see back-to-back nights of the 10th annual Nolafunk Mardi Gras Ball with the legendary Dr. John & the Nite Trippers. And these are just a few of the highlights!

Each show will also feature a full New Orleans-themed menu, cooked up by Michelin star celebrity chef Michael Psilakis. The menu is as follows for all shows with the exception of brunch, Dr. John and the crawfish boils, which can be found further below.

Take a look at the complete schedule breakdown below, and stay tuned for more shows to be announced in the coming weeks.

Mardi Gras Madness at The Hall at MP Schedule

12/29: Rebirth Brass Band w/ Nik Greeley & The Operators, DJ Cochon de Lait [Get Tickets]

Whether seen on HBO’s Treme or at their legendary Tuesday night gig at The Maple Leaf, Grammy-winning Rebirth Brass Band is a true New Orleans institution. The band has evolved from playing the streets of the French Quarter to playing festivals and stages all over the world. While committed to upholding the tradition of brass bands, they’ve also extended themselves into the realms of funk and hip-hop to create their signature sound.

1/9-31 Every Sat & Sun: Mardi Gras Boozy Brunch feat. High & Mighty Brass Band [FREE]

The High and Mighty Brass Band is a party already in progress. Their performances are both fiercely entertaining and refreshingly inspiring. The group’s sincere enthusiasm and dynamic energy connects with every audience member who is willing to get involved. Their sound is a mix of classic New Orleans Funk, R&B and more modern influences of Afro-Beat and Hip Hop.

NOLA-Inspired Brunch Menu:

1/22-30 Every Fri & Sat: New Orleans Mardi Gras Crawfish Boil Series [Get Tickets]

6pm-7pm Happy Hour with amazing drink specials

Friday 1/22 w/ Jambalaya Brass Band

Saturday 1/23 w/ Funky Dawgz Brass Band

Friday 1/29 w/ Black Tie Brass

Saturday 1/30 w/ Black Tie Brass

Crawfish Boil Menu:

2/5: Mardi Gras Ball w/ Dr. John & the Nite Trippers, Davell Crawford, Empire Strikes Brass w/ DJ Cochon de Lait [Get Tickets]

2/6: Mardi Gras Ball w/ Dr. John & the Nite Trippers, Soul Brass Band w/ DJ Cochon de Lait [Get Tickets]

Dr. John is universally celebrated as the living embodiment of the rich musical heritage exclusive to New Orleans. The six-time Grammy winner and Rock Hall inductee is on a roll with his band The Nite Trippers, headlining a string of US and international dates.

Mardi Gras Ball menu: same as Crawfish Boil menu above.

2/8: Lundi Gras Zydeco feat. CJ Chenier and Nathan & the Zydeco Cha Chas [Get Tickets]

C.J. Chenier, a Creole born and raised in an indigenous American culture with its distinct language, cuisine and music, delivers a soulful vocal and accordion. The Grammy-nominated, world renowned musician and recording artist has performed alongside many internationally recognized artists including his Grammy award-winning father, Clifton Chenier “The King of Zydeco”, Paul Simon, Joe Sample and Ray Parker, Jr., The Gin Blossoms, and John Mayall. He has appeared on the Jon Stewart Show, CNN and was featured on VH1 and Entertainment Weekly.

2/9: Fat Tuesday Crawfish Boil feat. Jambalaya Brass Band [Get Tickets]

6pm-7pm Happy Hour with amazing drink specials

The Jambalaya Brass Band is a group of seasoned musical pros from a variety of impressive previous musical settings as diverse as the Duke Ellington Orchestra to the Lounge Lizards. These purveyors of authentic American ‘roots’ music play a delightful spicy musical gumbo of New Orleans fare from the likes of Jelly Roll Morton and Louis Armstrong, to the Rebirth and Dirty Dozen brass bands, to the heights of their own modern sounds which incorporate elements of R&B, Gospel, Funk, Zydeco, Latin, Hip-Hop and Be-bop.

2/12: Flow Tribe [Get Tickets]

Straight out of New Orleans and into your earholes, Flow Tribe comes at you with the delicacy of a sledgehammer. They create “backbone cracking music”, a soul shaking mixture of styles and sounds guaranteed to drive you wild. These are 6 seasoned performers who have shared the stage with the likes of Trombone Shorty, Juvenile, and BIll Summers just to name a few. A relentlessly touring band that plays major venues and festivals around the country bringing with them a heat and passion best described as “bizarrely irresistible”.

2/20: John Papa Gros Band [Get Tickets]

Born in New Orleans, John “Papa” Gros, formerly of Papa Grows Funk, has spent more than a quarter-century championing the music of the Big Easy. He’s played it all — New Orleans funk, rock & roll, jazz, blues, Americana, pop/rock — and he swirls those styles into a genre-bending gumbo that pays tribute to his influences while still pushing ahead into new territory. Like Allen Toussaint and Dr. John, Gros is a proud local who carries on the tradition of New Orleans music, both honoring its past and helping to shape its future.

2/25: Marc Broussard with The Last Bandoleros, Peter Aristone [Get Tickets]

Broussard is an old-school Southern soul singer blessed with a rarefied gift and innate stylistic and emotional authenticity.

3/16: The Modern Nolatet (Johnny Vidacovich, Mike Dillon, James Singleton, Brian Haas) [Get Tickets]

Ft. Truthseekers

These four men have been in each other’s lives, either in close proximity or as distant heroes for many years. Johnny Vidacovich (drums) and James Singleton (upright bass) have been New Orleans’ best rhythm section since 1977. Mike Dillon (vibes and percussion) and Brian Haas (piano) have been sharing co-bills and sitting in with each other’s bands on the same touring circuit for over 20 years. All four musicians are fiercely independent iconoclasts and bandleaders who compose, play and navigate their musical lives in their own unique way.

3/25: Bonerama [Get Tickets]

Ft. Elise Testone’s For The Love Of NOLA

This 15 year old powerhouse brass touring band from New Orleans is unlike anything you’ve heard before. In addition to changing the way people think about the trombone, the sound of Bonerama has become an influence and contribution to the sound of New Orleans music today.
